short_summary: Implementation of an Engagement Strategy to Capture the Lived Experiences of Individuals from Equity-Deserving Groups Using ESDC’s Skills and Employment Programs
description: Description of the Requirement: The Skills and Employment Branch (SEB) at Employment and Social Development Canada (ESDC) requires the services of a Contractor to: 1) Complete a review of ESDC skills and employment program evaluation reports and other relevant literature based on the research questions; and 2) Engage with the following target population on the research questions below and report on findings. Individuals from equity-deserving groups who meet at least one of the following criteria: Received EI benefits and used Job Bank within the last 3 years to find a job; or Were unemployed within the past 3 years and used Job Bank to find a job; or Were employed within the past 3 years and used Job Bank to find another job. The findings from this research will inform the development and implementation of SEB policies and programs in order to make skills and employment programs more accessible, inclusive and responsive to the different labour market needs of individuals.
